If the fetus is alive and viable 
• If the fetal heart rate is >100/minute as recorded on CTG, resuscitate the patient and perform emergency CD,
unless delivery is imminent (cervix ≥9 cm dilated).
o NB: Be sure that the patient is haemodynamically stable, and that the fetus  r eally is alive on
ultrasound before surgery. A CTG occasionally picks up a maternal heart rate when the fetus has
already died.
• For a non-viable baby, rupture the membranes and plan vaginal delivery. Occasionall
